content.question: Raphael’s School of Athens was likely interpreted by his contemporaries as both an homage to classicism and a reflection of

choices.label: Rome’s rise as a center of learning under Julius II
Raphael’s interest in then-current scientific debates
Leo X’s suppression of the Protestant Reformation

content.answer: Rome’s rise as a center of learning under Julius II

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
